security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and templates. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond standard AI tools. The SKILL.md file provides structured templates for generating markdown reports.

content.value_statement: Task completion details get lost over time. This skill provides structured templates for documenting changes, impact analysis, and verification results so your team can track any project six months later.
actual_capabilities: Generates structured markdown reports with required sections
Organizes changes by file with diff comparisons
Documents impact analysis with direct and indirect effects
Creates verification checklists with command results
Tracks follow-up tasks as actionable checklists
limitations: Requires user to provide actual change details
Does not execute git commands itself
Does not verify that reported changes are accurate

use_cases.title: Document code changes
use_cases.description: Create changelogs after completing features or bug fixes to help teammates understand what changed and why.

use_cases.title: Report test results
use_cases.description: Document test outcomes, verification commands, and quality metrics for release documentation.

use_cases.title: Write audit reports
use_cases.description: Generate security audit documentation with impact analysis and remediation steps for compliance records.

prompt_templates.title: Quick status report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a brief report for a completed task. Use the report-writing skill template. Task: [describe what you completed]. Include: change summary, files affected, and one follow-up item if needed.

prompt_templates.title: Full feature documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive report using the report-writing skill template. Document [feature name] implementation including: overview table, all changed files with descriptions, diff examples, verification results, and all follow-up tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Security audit trail
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a security-focused report using the report-writing skill. Document the security change with: reason for change, security impact analysis, files modified, and security verification steps.

prompt_templates.title: Migration completion
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a migration completion report using the report-writing skill. Include: migration rationale, before/after structure comparison, affected systems, migration commands run, and verification checklist.

output_examples.input: Create a report for the user authentication feature I just completed. I added login, logout, and password reset functionality. Modified auth.js, login.html, logout.php, and reset.html. All tests pass.

best_practices: Include the actual git diff or code snippets so reviewers can see exact changes
Document both direct impacts and indirect dependencies that may be affected
List verification commands you actually ran with their results for accountability
anti_patterns: Writing vague descriptions that do not explain why the change was necessary
Skipping the verification section so future developers cannot reproduce tests
Omitting follow-up tasks that are still pending, creating hidden work debt

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses Read, Glob, Grep, and Write tools to gather information and create report files.

faq.question: What report formats are supported?
faq.answer: Only markdown format is supported. Reports are saved as YYYY-MM-DD-<title>-report.md files in your docs/reports directory.

faq.question: How does this integrate with git workflows?
faq.answer: The skill references git commands like git status and git diff in its templates, but does not execute them. You provide the output or the AI runs them through tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates text templates using the AI. No data is sent to external servers beyond normal AI tool communication.

faq.question: Why are my reports not appearing in the expected location?
faq.answer: Ensure the docs/reports directory exists. File names must follow the YYYY-MM-DD-<title>-report.md format exactly.

faq.question: How is this different from changelog generation?
faq.answer: Changelogs summarize release-level changes. This skill creates detailed per-task reports with diffs, impact analysis, and verification results for project documentation.
